FuncDef:
The radius-attribute case-sensitive qos-profile-name command allows a RADIUS server to support case-sensitive RADIUS attribute names.
The undo radius-attribute case-sensitive qos-profile-name command allows a RADIUS server to support case-insensitive RADIUS attribute names.
By default, a RADIUS server supports case-insensitive RADIUS attribute names, meaning all names are considered as lower-case ones.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To allow the NE40E to support case-sensitive QoS profile names that some RADIUS servers deliver, run the radius-server attribute case-sensitive command.
Configuration Impact
the NE40E supports case-sensitive attributes of HW-Subscriber-QoS-Profile numbered 17 and HW-QoS-Profile-Name numbered 31 that some RADIUS servers deliver.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
The QoS profile name on the NE40E must be the same as the QoS profile name that a RADIUS server delivers. If they use different cases, inconsistency causes the NE40E to use QoS policies incorrectly.
